required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of the proposed study is to test the capability of the CareTaker monitor to extract the respiration signature from its acquired signal, and to determine a respiration rate of breaths/minute that meets or exceeds the performance levels of its predicate device.

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of the proposed study is to test the capability of the CareTaker monitor to extract the respiration signature from its acquired signal, and to determine a respiration rate of breaths/minute that meets or exceeds the performance levels of its predicate device.
The detection approach of RSPR (respiratory rate) that the CareTaker technology takes is based on peak detection and pulse analysis of arterial pressure pulse signals, as well as spectral analysis of the raw CareTaker sensor signal.
The study was performed under the supervision of the Chesapeake IRB and involved 21 subjects >18 y who were monitored during spontaneous and metronome-paced breathing.

primary_outcome.measure: Respiration rate detection with accuracy of better than 3 breaths per minute
primary_outcome.description: Comparison with performance of predicate device (accuracy within 3 breaths per minute).

intervention.description: Equivalence of CareTaker's respiration rate detection capability to that of predicate device

study_pop.textblock: Subjects were local health club members, > 18 years of age, who were able and willing to participate and willing to sign the written consent

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 18 years of age, who are able and willing to participate and have given verbal assent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to give written consent
- <18 years of age
- No or poor finger pulse, as determined through visual inspection for ischemic hands
